content.value_statement: Keep track of all network hosts and devices across your UniFi infrastructure. Get comprehensive visibility into device status, configuration, and health across multiple sites.

Get detailed device configuration and status

best_practices: Use consistent device naming conventions across all sites
Document device purposes and physical locations in descriptions
Regularly review device configurations for standardization
anti_patterns: Avoid generic device names that do not indicate location or purpose
Do not ignore offline devices - investigate connectivity issues promptly
Never share controller credentials or API keys in chat

faq.question: Which UniFi controller versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with UniFi Network Controller 6.0+ and UniFi OS Console devices. Requires API access enabled.

faq.question: Can I modify device configurations through this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides read-only access for monitoring and inventory. Use UniFi controller for configuration changes.

faq.question: How does the skill connect to my UniFi infrastructure?
faq.answer: Connects via UniFi controller API using your controller URL and API credentials configured in the MCP server.

faq.question: Is my infrastructure data secure?
faq.answer: All data remains in your local MCP server. No information is transmitted to external services or stored permanently.

faq.question: What if devices show as offline?
faq.answer: Check physical connections, power status, and network connectivity. Verify device adoption status in UniFi controller.

faq.question: How is this different from the UniFi controller interface?
faq.answer: Provides conversational access to infrastructure data and can combine information from multiple sites in unified views.
